objectiveDescription: Provide a structured approach to ensure optimal recruitment/acquisition, planning, evaluation and development of human resources (both internal and external).
objectivePurpose: Optimize human resources capabilities to meet enterprise objectives.

subComponents.subComponentName: Portfolio of competitive products and services

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Percent of products and services that meet or exceed targets in revenues and/or market share
Percent of products and services that meet or exceed customer satisfaction targets
Percent of products and services that provide competitive advantage
Time to market for new products and services
Staff productivity compared to benchmarks
Level of stakeholder satisfaction with staff expertise and skills
Percent of staff whose skills are insufficient for competency in their role
Percent of satisfied staff
Level of awareness and understanding of business innovation opportunities
Stakeholder satisfaction with levels of product and innovation expertise and ideas
Number of approved product and service initiatives resulting from innovative ideas

subComponents.subComponentName: Competent and motivated staff with mutual understanding of technology and business

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Percent of I&T-savvy business people (i.e., those having the required knowledge and understanding of I&T to guide, direct, innovate and see I&T opportunities in their domain of business expertise)

Percent of business-savvy I&T people (i.e., those having the required knowledge and understanding of relevant business domains to guide, direct, innovate and see I&T opportunities for the business domain)
Number or percentage of business people with technology management experience

subComponents.subComponentName: Knowledge, expertise and initiatives for business innovation

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Level of business executive awareness and understanding of I&T innovation possibilities
Number of approved initiatives resulting from innovative I&T ideas
Number of innovation champions recognized/awarded

subComponents.subComponentName: Acquire and maintain adequate and appropriate staffing.
subComponents.subComponentDescription: Establish and maintain a method to manage and account for all I&Trelated costs, investments and depreciation as an integral part of the enterprise financial systems and accounts. Report using the enterprise’s financial measurement systems.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: . Evaluate staffing requirements on a regular basis or upon major changes. Ensure that both the enterprise and the IT function have sufficient resources to support enterprise goals and objectives, business processes and controls, and I&T-enabled initiatives adequately and appropriately.
Maintain business and IT personnel recruitment and retention processes in line with the overall enterprise’s personnel policies and procedures.
Establish flexible resource arrangements, such as the use of transfers, external contractors and third-party service arrangements, to support changing business needs.

Include background checks in the IT recruitment process for employees, contractors and vendors. The extent and frequency of these checks should depend on the sensitivity and/or criticality of the function.

subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: Skills Framework for the Information Age V6, 2015

subComponents.subComponentDescription: Identify key IT personnel. Use knowledge capture (documentation), knowledge sharing, succession planning and staff backup to minimize reliance on a single individual performing a critical job function.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: As a security precaution, provide guidelines on a minimum time of annual vacation to be taken by key individuals
Take appropriate actions regarding job changes, especially job terminations.

Use knowledge capture (documentation), knowledge sharing, succession planning, staff backup, cross-training and job rotation initiatives to minimize reliance on a single individual performing a critical job function.
Regularly test staff backup plans.

subComponentQuestions.detailedReference: RI.RR Identification of Roles and Responsibilities

subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: Skills Framework for the Information Age V6, 2015

subComponents.subComponentName: Maintain the skills and competencies of personnel.
subComponents.subComponentDescription: Define and manage the skills and competencies required of personnel. Regularly verify that personnel have the competencies to fulfill their roles on the basis of their education, training and/or experience. Verify that these competencies are being maintained, using qualification and certification programs where appropriate. Provide employees with ongoing learning and opportunities to maintain their knowledge, skills and competencies at a level required to achieve enterprise goals.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Identify currently available skills and competencies of internal and external resources.

Identify gaps between required and available skills. Develop action plans, such as training (technical and behavioral skills), recruitment, redeployment and changed sourcing strategies, to address the gaps on an individual and collective basis.
Review training materials and programs on a regular basis. Ensure adequacy with respect to changing enterprise requirements and their impact on necessary knowledge, skills and abilities.
Provide access to knowledge repositories to support the development of skills and competencies.
Develop and deliver training programs based on organizational and process requirements, including requirements for enterprise knowledge, internal control, ethical conduct, security and privacy.
Conduct regular reviews to assess the evolution of the skills and competencies of the internal and external resources. Review succession planning.

subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: ISF, The Standard of Good Practice for Information Security 2016
National Institute of Standards and Technology Framework for Improving Critical Infrastructure Cybersecurity V1.1, April 2018
National Institute of Standards and Technology Special Publication 800-53, Revision 5 (Draft), August 2017
Skills Framework for the Information Age V6, 2015
The CIS Critical Security Controls for Effective Cyber Defense Version 6.1, August 2016
subComponentQuestions.detailedReference: CSC 17: Security Skills Assessment and Appropriate Training to Fill Gaps

subComponents.subComponentName: Assess and recognize/reward employee job performance.
subComponents.subComponentDescription: Conduct timely, regular performance evaluations against individual objectives derived from enterprise goals, established standards, specific job responsibilities, and the skills and competency framework. Implement a remuneration/recognition process that rewards successful ttainment of performance goals.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Consider functional/enterprise goals as the context for setting individual goals

Set individual goals aligned with the relevant I&T and enterprise goals. Base goals on specific, measurable, achievable, relevant and time-bound (SMART) objectives that reflect core competencies, enterprise values and skills required for the role(s).
Provide timely feedback regarding performance against the individual’s goals.
Provide specific instructions for the use and storage of personal information in the evaluation process, in compliance with applicable personal data and employment legislation.
Compile 360-degree performance evaluation results.

Provide formal career planning and professional development plans based on the results of the evaluation process to encourage competency development and opportunities for personal advancement and to reduce dependence on key individuals. Provide employee coaching on performance and conduct whenever appropriate.

Implement a remuneration/recognition process that rewards appropriate commitment, competency development and successful attainment of performance goals. Ensure that the process is applied consistently and in line with organizational policies.
Implement and communicate a disciplinary process

subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: Skills Framework for the Information Age V6, 2015

subComponents.subComponentName: Plan and track the usage of IT and business human resources.
subComponents.subComponentDescription: Understand and track the current and future demand for business and IT human resources with responsibilities for enterprise I&T. Identify shortfalls and provide input into sourcing plans, enterprise and IT recruitment processes, and business and IT recruitment processes.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: Create and maintain an inventory of business and IT human resources.

Understand the current and future demand for human resources to support the achievement of I&T objectives and to deliver services and solutions based on the portfolio of current I&T-related initiatives, the future investment portfolio and day-to-day operational needs.
dentify shortfalls and provide input into sourcing plans as well as enterprise and IT recruitment processes. Create and review the staffing plan, keeping track of actual usage.
Maintain adequate information on the time spent on different tasks, assignments, services or projects.

subComponentQuestions.relatedGuidance: Skills Framework for the Information Age V6, 2015

subComponents.subComponentDescription: Ensure that consultants and contract personnel who support the enterprise with I&T skills know and comply with the organization’s policies and meet agreed contractual requirements.

subComponentQuestions.questionDescription: mplement contract staff policies and procedures.

At the commencement of the contract, obtain formal agreement from contractors that they are required to comply with the enterprise’s I&T control framework, such as policies for security clearance, physical and logical access control, use of facilities, information confidentiality requirements, and nondisclosure agreements.
Advise contractors that management reserves the right to monitor and inspect all usage of IT resources, including email, voice communications, and all programs and data files.
As part of their contracts, provide contractors with a clear definition of their roles and responsibilities, including explicit requirements to document their work to agreed standards and formats.
Review contractors’ work and base the approval of payments on the results.
In formal and unambiguous contracts, define all work performed by external parties.
Conduct periodic reviews to ensure that contract staff have signed and agreed on all necessary agreements
Conduct periodic reviews to ensure that contractors’ roles and access rights are appropriate and in line with agreements.

componentQuestions.policyDescription: Enumerates criteria for augmenting staff with third-party consultants and/or contractors in accordance with enterprise IT procurement policy and the I&T control framework. Specifies what type of work can be performed or augmented by third parties, under what conditions, and when.

componentQuestions.policyDescription: Outlines mutual expectations of the enterprise and its employees. Enumerates acceptable and unacceptable employee behaviors in a code of conduct to help manage risk related to human behavior.

componentQuestions.keyCultureElement: Describe the roles and responsibilities of users toward information, media and network usage, security, and privacy. Encourage and communicate a common culture that prescribes expected behaviors for all individuals in the enterprise and establishes zero tolerance for unethical behaviors.
